                                            By 
Jack Shafer


                "I know he's made some mistakes, but who hasn't?" Willie Robertson said.  | Getty

            By 
Kevin Robillard

11/12/15 05:31 PM EST
A new TV ad from GOP Sen. David Vitter's Louisiana gubernatorial campaign features "Duck Dynasty" star Willie Robertson offering his forgiveness to Vitter.
Vitter, wearing camouflage, stands next to Robertson throughout the 30-second spot, which continues Vitter's recent strategy of confronting his 2007 prostitution scandal, albeit indirectly, and shifting the conversation to his political conservatism. 
Story Continued Below
"David and I have been out in the woods today. I know he's made some mistakes, but who hasn't? The whole story of the Bible is about redemption," Robertson says in the ad. "I'm concerned about our state." 
"That's right, Willie," Vitter responds. "What defines us in life is how we get up and earn redemption. Where we are as a state is needing to get up based on strong conservative principles, and that's what I'm leading with."
"Man, you need to grow a better beard," Robertson says to the clean-shaven Vitter.
"You'll need to talk to Wendy about that," Vitter replies, referring to his wife.



            By 
Nolan D. McCaskill

The Robertson clan's political record is mixed. They endorsed a failed congressional candidate in 2014 and have backed incumbent Louisiana Gov. Bobby Jindal's faltering presidential bid.
Polls show Vitter, once a heavy favorite, trailing Democratic state Rep. John Bel Edwards. Shortly after the ad's release, Edwards' campaign blasted out a 2014 Baton Rouge Advocate article where Vitter declares: "I'm not even running to gain a cameo appearance on 'Duck Dynasty.'"
John Brabender is Vitter's long-time media consultant.
Watch the ad, "David and Willie," here.
 © 2015 POLITICO LLC
title: Vitter ad stars Duck Dynasty's Willie Robertson
